p: A high RH of > 95% and temperature of 28 °C or 33 °C did not significantly affect the infectivity of SARS-CoV HKU 39849. Increasing the temperature to 38 °C disfavors the virus, with the virus rapidly losing viability (3 log 10) at 38 °C and RH of > 95% (Table 1)[ 37]. A high temperature ( e.g., 30 °C or 40 °C) reduced the persistence duration of highly pathogenic MERS-CoV, TGEV, and MHV. The persistence of SARS-CoV was longer with higher inocula. HCoV-229E at RT persists longer at RH 50% than at RH 30%.
